description.p: Paladins who swear the Oath of Beauty hold themselves to a lofty standard of excellence. They strive to appear as beautiful gleaming beacons of elegance. Some use the power of their graceful visage to inspire and give hope to the downtrodden. Others turn inwards and become obsessed with their appearance and standing in society, using the power of their Oath to seduce, deceive, and intimidate those beneath them.
Those who swear this Oath do so for both altruistic and selfish purposes, but they share they all share these tenets.
Elegance. You must hold yourself to the highest societal standards, expectations, and customs. Reputation can open many doors that remain closed to those of ill repute.
Grace. You are a cut above the poor and working class, and you must exemplify that dignity in your combat techniques, leisurely pursuits, and all your public actions.
Perfection. Those who swear this Oath should strive always to improve themselves in not only their skill in combat, but their personal appearance and reputation.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Otherworldly Elegance. As an action, you touch your holy symbol, and divinely enhance your beauty. For the next hour, whenever you make a Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion check, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

Quell the Defiler. As a reaction, when a creature you can see within 30 feet attacks you, you can force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, their attack misses, and they are charmed by you until the end of your next turn. The charm ends early if you attack the creature.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

description.p: Paladins who swear the Oath of the Blade seek to become masterful warriors and paragons of battle. Sometimes called blade masters, these elite warriors devote their lives to mastering the armaments of war. Some blade masters serve as mercenaries, others as guardians or bodyguards. No matter their station, they are always on the lookout for skilled warriors to measure their own combat prowess against.
Though Blade Paladins vary in motivation and alignment, they all uphold the same tenets of swordsmanship.
Fair Play. True warriors will fight on a level playing field. Do not stoop to crushing enemies and adversaries who are beneath you unless you first level the playing field.
Respect. Those who hold to the Tenets of the Blade, and all warriors who prove themselves in combat, deserve your respect as a fellow combatant, no matter their motivations.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Sacred Duel. As bonus action, you can hold aloft your holy symbol and initiate a sacred duel. One willing, but hostile, creature can enter into this duel with you, marking you both as duelists. For the duration, both duelists have resistance to all damage, except damage from the other duelist.
This sacred duel lasts for one minute, or until one of the creatures who entered into the duel falls unconscious.

As bonus action, you can hold aloft your holy symbol and initiate a sacred duel. One willing, but hostile, creature can enter into this duel with you, marking you both as duelists. For the duration, both duelists have resistance to all damage, except damage from the other duelist.
This sacred duel lasts for one minute, or until one of the creatures who entered into the duel falls unconscious.

description.p: You can utilize advanced martial techniques. When you take this Oath at 3rd level, you gain the following features:

Maneuvers. You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the list of Battle Master maneuvers found in the Player's Handbook. You can use only one maneuver per attack. When you gain a level in this class you can replace one maneuver you know with another maneuver of your choice.

Superiority Dice. You have three superiority dice, which are d6s for you. You must expend a superiority die to use once of your maneuvers. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
Saving Throws. Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

Your skills with the armaments of war have improved. Starting at 7th level in this class, you gain an additional superiority die, and all your superiority dice become d8s. You also learn two additional maneuvers of your choice.

Upon reaching 18th level, your skills increase even further, rivaling even warriors of legend. You gain another superiority die (for a total of five), and your superiority dice become d10s. You also learn two more maneuvers of your choice.

Your skills as a duelist allow you to strike back at those who dare to strike you. Beginning at 15th level, when a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to immediately make a melee weapon attack against that creature, with advantage on your attack roll.

This feature ends if you are incapacitated. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, or you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

description.p: Fearsome warriors of the high seas, Corsair Paladins, swear an Oath to themselves and their crew, and will do whatever it takes to maintain their freedom. Chaotic by nature, these scallywags abhor any laws that aren't their own. While most paladins follow the law of the land or the tenets of their deity, Corsairs follow only laws they have personally agree to.
Though Blade Paladins vary in motivation and alignment, they all uphold the same tenets of swordsmanship.
Bravery. To be a coward is worse then death. Those who don't defend themselves deserve whatever comes. Live in such a way that all will sing of your deeds for years to come.
Freedom. Mortal creatures are meant to be free. Like the fish of the sea, no one should be forced to follow rules that they did not personally agree to or have a voice in creating.
Loyalty. Those that betray their allies are the lowest of low creatures. Traitors must be dealt with swift judgment. Loyal allies are rewarded with glory, prestige, and treasure.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

All Hands on Deck. As a bonus action, you hold aloft your holy symbol and you bellow an order to your crew. A number of creatures of your choice, equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), within 30 feet, that can see or hear you, can use their reaction to move up to their full movement speed, without provoking any opportunity attacks.

Wrath of the Sea. When you use your Divine Smite, you can invoke this Channel Divinity. All weapon and Divine Smite damage becomes cold, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice), and if you roll a 1 or 2 for any of the damage dice you can re-roll those dice, but must use the new result.

description.p: Since the dawn of time the mortal world has been plagued by the scourge that is undeath. Created by dark emotions and malicious magic, ghosts, ghouls, and undead of all sorts have plagued the mortal races since they took their first steps.

As ancient as this threat itself, a brotherhood of paladins known as Exorcists have protected the living from the dead. Willing to sacrifice their very selves, these warriors taint their soul with the foul magic of undeath. Once mastered, they use their dark powers to drive back the darkness itself. Giving up any chance of a normal life, Exorcists work tirelessly to prevent the tide of undeath from overwhelming the living.
Though Blade Paladins vary in motivation and alignment, they all uphold the same tenets of swordsmanship.
Protect the Living. Life is a precious gift given to mortals, and life, especially innocent life, is to be protected at all costs.
Destroy Undeath. Foul creatures created by the dark magic of necromancy are a cruel mockery of life and must be rooted out and destroyed wherever they exist.
Selfless Vigil. Those who swear the Oath of the Exorcist renounce their rights to a normal life. They bear no titles or honors, inherit no lands, and have no family or children.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Sinister Insights. As an action on your turn, you can grasp your holy symbol to enhance your knowledge of the dark creatures of undeath. For the next hour, you have advantage on any Wisdom or Intelligence-based ability checks you make related to undead creatures or necromancy magic.

Warrior of the Dawn. You can draw forth radiant power from your soul to strike your foes. As a bonus action, you can touch your holy symbol and choose a creature within 30 feet. For the next minute, each time you hit that creature with a weapon attack, you deal an additional 1d4 radiant damage.

description.p: Truth. The dedicated warriors who become inquisitors all have this same goal: reveal what is hidden, and purge the world of those who obscure the truth. Inquisitors will stop at nothing to accomplish their goals, and unlike most, they are pure utilitarians, believing that the ends justify the means.

Above all else they despise those that hide their intentions or true forms. Fiend, celestial, or fey; it matters not to a inquisitor paladin. If a creature uses its considerable power to deceive mortals, their lives are forfeit.
Paladins who swear the Oath of Inquisition will stop at nothing to discover the truth, and are always forthright with their purpose, refusing to hide who they are.
Absolute Truth. The truth is out there, and you must do whatever it takes to bring it to light. Those who hide the truth deserve punishment, and you will deliver that justice.
Immutable Forms. All creatures of the multiverse have a natural form. Those that would seek to physically alter their form or obscure it with magic must be reprimanded.
Swift Retribution. Those who break the laws of the multiverse deserve punishment equivalent to their crimes. The thief must lose his hand, oathbreakers forfeit their lives.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Sinister Insights. As an action on your turn, you can grasp your holy symbol to enhance your knowledge of the dark creatures of undeath. For the next hour, you have advantage on any Wisdom or Intelligence-based ability checks you make related to undead creatures or necromancy magic.

Warrior of the Dawn. You can draw forth radiant power from your soul to strike your foes. As a bonus action, you can touch your holy symbol and choose a creature within 30 feet. For the next minute, each time you hit that creature with a weapon attack, you deal an additional 1d4 radiant damage.

As an action on your turn, you can grasp your holy symbol and force one creature within 10 feet, to make an Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you learn the true name of the creature, and the creature has disadvantage on the first Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw you force it to make within the next minute.

description.p: The Oath of Liberty calls paladins to use their power to stand with the oppressed against tyranny. It is not enough to enact justice, but to see that justice is fairly applied to all. Despised by those who have seized power through unjust means, paladins who have taken this oath are seen as threats to the established order, and are often persecuted by the nobility.
A paladin of Liberty often emblazons their oath upon their shield and refuses to hide or obscure what they stand for.

Equality. Birth, wealth, and status do not matter. Everyone is equal before your eyes, the mighty should be made low, and the lowly raised up. All people should have access to basic needs regardless of their wealth or family ties.
Freedom. Every creature has a right to be free and equal under the law of the land. Bring freedom to those who are enslaved and bring justice to those who abuse their power.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Shield the Meek. As a reaction, when a creature within 30 feet, that you can see, is hit with a melee attack, you grant them a bonus to their armor class equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) until the start of your next turn.

Rebuke the Tyrannical. As a reaction, you can rebuke an enemy creature that damages a friendly creature within 30 feet of you. For the next minute, the triggering attacker has disadvantage on any attack rolls not targeting you.
